column1: Description of cooling systems for environment walls
A number of cooling systems are used at the department for thermal
vacuum testing. For the 2.2 metre facility these include direct
cooling using liquid nitrogen (LN2), and indirect cooling using
re-circulating fluid loops. The souce of LN2 is a 6000 litre storage
vessel situated close to the facilities, Fig 1.
The liquid nitrogen is distributed around the facilities via
super-insulated vacuum lines, and supplied to the various thermal
vacuum chambers from pressurised, multiple-outlet phase separators,
Fig 2. Boil-off gas from the storage vessel is used for purging and
back-filling chambers at the end of thermal vacuum testing.
